clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Cisapride in Patients With Symptomatic Gastro-Oesophageal Reflux Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled Clinical Trial to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of R051619 (Cisapride Oral Suspension 0.2 mg/kg q.i.d.) for the Treatment of Symptomatic Gastro-Oesophageal Reflux Disease (GORD) in Infants and Children

lead_sponsor.agency: Johnson & Johnson Pharmaceutical Research & Development, L.L.C.

clinical_study.source: Johnson & Johnson Pharmaceutical Research & Development, L.L.C.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy and tolerability of cisapride with placebo in infants and children with gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (GORD).

detailed_description.textblock: This is a double-blind (neither patient nor study staff will know the identity of the assigned treatment) study evaluate the effectiveness and safety of cisapride in patients with gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (GORD) (also referred to as gastroesophageal reflux disease [GERD[) compared to a placebo (a identical in appearance to cisapride but does not contain active drug). Patients will receive placebo or cisapride suspension at 0.2 mg/kg (volumn determined by patient weight) four times per day (q.i.d.) (15 minutes before feeding 3 times a day and at bedtime) orally (by mouth) for 8 weeks.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Caregiver's assessment of infant pediatric GORD symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: The number and type of adverse events reported
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of first dose to the last dose (up to 8 weeks)

arm_group.description: Placebo Suspension identical in appearance to cisapride q.i.d. for 8 weeks.

intervention.description: Suspension identical in appearance to cisapride q.i.d. for 8 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of GORD based on protocol-specified characteristics
- Failed the 1st of 5 stepwise treatments for GORD recommended by the European Society of Pediatric Gastroenterology, Hepatology and Nutrition (ESPGHAN)
- Caregiver able to complete the I-GERQ-R questionnaire
Exclusion Criteria:
- Protocol-specified respiratory conditions requiring previous or current treatment with oral or intravenous corticosteroids (prior and concurrent use of inhaled corticosteroids is acceptable)
- Cause of vomiting/regurgitation other than GORD
- Prior history of cisapride intake
